intro: Frolovia ledebouriana, commonly known as the Antarctic hair-crinum, is a flowering plant native to the southern regions of South America. It belongs to the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its unique, showy inflorescence composed of numerous white to pale pink flowers. The plant thrives in cold, high-altitude environments and is adapted to withstand harsh climatic conditions. Its leaves are typically narrow and grass-like, while its bulbous root system stores nutrients for survival. Frolovia ledeburiana is of interest to botanists due to its specialized adaptations and limited distribution.
